title: how to find address in memory using ADRP and ADD (ARM64) instructions?
content:
This part of the disassembler code takes the symbol "1" from memory to change i I need to know what address is assigned to the "x1" register, but the debugger does not work for me.

I have little experience in reverse engineering so I would appreciate any help.

comments.text: Hello, it's you again :)) It seems that you found the location of that N variable in the last post. If I calculated correctly, the address in x1 is 0x4151250. Good luck!
yes it's me haha. I changed the instructions a bit. Very strange, there is no address 0x4151250 in the code
It seems to me that something is wrong with my disassembler, I studied ARDP instructions, you specified the address correctly

The problem is that I am parsing an IOS application, the debugger is not working, most likely due to the fact that this application cannot be run on the computer Have you had experience debugging iOS applications?
yes i have a jailbroken device, i will try to install gdb
